title: This game's rules are toxic
body:
So I got chat restriction for calling people stupid after they said they would report for me afking a 3vs5. This draven didn't do anything and didnt dc just stood in fountain the entire game. Apparently there is an agreement to play the game till the end no matter what happens. That idea is toxic. It is obviously stupid in this situation. Why would you make yourself miserable for any longer than you need? There should also be a remake option when your ally is level 1 with no items 10 minutes in.

Welp, this game has been more frustrating for me in the past few weeks than it had been when I first started. Is the chat restriction automatic or reviewed by other people? I don't think I can keep on playing this stupid game where people actually think forcing others to play 3vs5 is good. I still have no idea if Catilyn and Ekko got punished for their behavior which adds insult to injury. Dealing with these dumb players is worse than having a feeder or leaver. I have also had feeders or leavers that doesn't nearly trigger me as much as stupid people.
I got a 25 match chat restriction because of this. Time to troll some games because screw this game. Not even level 30 and i want to quit already.

replies.body: Ironically, if you had just AFKed literally none of this would have happened.  2 people defending a base likely can't stop 5 for long enough to even trigger the leaver detection.  It's that you lack the self-control to not respond to trolls, or better yet to mute them, than you ended up getting penalized.
100% true draven and singed got off with nothing more likely than not

So not only did you leave a game (toxic in and of itself), you flamed people for saying they'd **CORRECTLY** report you for violating the rules?

Completely deserved. The game's rules aren't toxic - you got punished because the rules are in place to prevent toxicity because of yours. If you want to go troll, we'll see you back here complaining about your "incorrect" ban for doing so.

I was miserable playing a losing game. How was the rule not toxic in this situation? You think people don't get upset at having to play in unfair circumstances such as 3vs5? Do I have to type out that the circumstance is just punishing? If you lane you are likely to die. You get less CS and you are very likely to lose anyway. Why would putting players through that situation be ok? Why can't you think before you type?

You left the game. You AFKed. Same difference. The rule works because **you do not get to be selfish just because someone else broke the rules first**. If you're miserable playing a team game, don't play a team game.

Wow you are blatantly not understanding it now. If I get upset at you its my fault because you are clearly lacking in the ability to think. "If you're miserable playing a team game, don't play a team game." Do you not understand the circumstance that is 3vs5? And there are tons of players that would be upset with a 3vs5. All of those players shouldn't be playing LoL if they afk a 3vs5. Did you know dominion and twisted tree line closed because there isn't enough players. 

I would welcome players who leave a 4vs5 when there is no chance because it quickens surrender. 

"you do not get to be selfish just because someone else broke the rules first"  You know what selfish means right? It means thinking about yourself and doing things for yourself. Why does that matter in this context? Explain how I ruined someone's game in this circumstances and how I wouldn't have ruined it by playing. From the other side, would Ekko also be selfish for making me play an almost unwinnable game? For denying me and singed the ability to join another game? 

Rules are everything to you because you can't think. You didn't even answer why putting players through those circumstances would be ok. You really amaze me. Its actually pretty funny to read your previous posts and realize you are not even trolling.

Basically, you entered a contract by agreeing to play League, that you would not willingly leave games. There is no further thought required. You violated the contract, and Riot's prerogative is to punish you for it.

Yet they're lenient. They'll permit a violation here and there- they know there are valid reasons to violate the contract. It remains that AFK is a violation. Your time is worth something to Riot, and they expect you to give that time to see the game through by playing the game. Nothing is truly free.

With this, other's behavior is entirely irrelevant. Context does not matter. The majority of 'reasons' don't matter (only extreme cases do). You went AFK, period. And on top of that, you really did flame- this chunk in particular is where most of it is at.

Usually I just let him handle cases like this, but nobody is deserving of any grace lately...

"Beyond that, you flamed people because they weren't doing what you wanted (selfish), you're saying they didn't get punished so clearly the rules are unfair (Selfish), and you're refusing to acknowledge the error of your ways (SELFISH)."

Do you not understand I flame others for trolling me and flaming me? It was explained that Ekko said he denied surrender for the sake of wanting to waste my time. You read my other post. You think its selfish to fight back? RIOT DOESN'T CARE ABOUT ME BUT AS A HUMAN IT MATTERS. I DON'T LET OTHER PEOPLE WALK OVER ME. So what if I was selfish in that situation? I should be as a normal person.

"BobTheNoodles: i dunno why they wanna make more ppl suffer Wild accusation
BobTheNoodles: why force other players
BobTheNoodles: to play unwinnable games
BobTheNoodles: or miserable games
Selfish, again an accusation" 

THINK ABOUT IT WHY DOES IT MATTER IF IM SELFISH IN THIS WAY? I didn't ruin the game by afk in a 3 vs 5. That's an accusation? Do you mean assumption? Do I need to prove to you that playing a losing game is miserable? Why can't I say that forcing other ppl to play a losing game would make them miserable. ITS JUST HOW IT IS MOST OF THE TIME. MOST PEOPLE DON'T WANT TO PLAY A LOSING GAME. Are you actually suggesting that most people wouldn't be miserable playing a losing game? Maybe you just didn't read my other post that you commented on. EKKO LITERALLY SAID HE DENIED FF JUST TO WASTE MY TIME. Just wondering, are you in college?

You are basically calling me selfish for the sake of calling me selfish. 

Another thing is. Riot doesn't actually care if you leave the game. I wasn't punished for being afk. I was punished for flaming people who flamed me. The worst part is that they actually think its ok to flame ppl into playing 3vs5

I do think we need to defend ourselves at times, but insulting them is not the way, especially when the offenders aren't particularly being aggravating (that's not to say annoying, but a legitimate attempt to incur your wrath). Was your ego really being heedlessly trampled? Was your self confidence in danger of unwarranted sufferance? Are you sure you deserved no ire or criticism? 

Because your feelings aren't really the issue from any fair perspective. You control them.

Yes, you accused them of holding you hostage to a miserable game. Like they wanted you to suffer. Even if it were true, you're just feeding them by saying as much. And if they just wanted to play the damn game and for you to shut up, you were extremely childish at that point. MOST PEOPLE would be in the latter category (see rujitra), and its pretty immature to presume otherwise- even if they said as much, they were probably just teasing and couldn't care less about you. Either way, your chat was wrong.

If you're having a miserable time because you're losing, you're doing it wrong. If you play to win, losing games are the best times to learn how to improve, and realize your errors. But you won't improve if you don't acknowledge that or your errors. Since that's clearly not happening, you're just meandering through games, enjoying the ones you win, and suffering the ones you don't. People don't want to lose, but you shouldn't be MISERABLE. Even in the most one-sided ones.

Riot does care if you leave, as I said, they just give you free passes.

Your point that Riot's rules are ...what was it? Ah, yes. TOXIC. Its baseless. They are made for their own benefit- that is, Riot's profit- but they're not toxic. At worst, they're serviceable to us, and somewhat heedless to some of our needs as a whole, but they're definitely NOT in such a state to enrage you. You're just being unreasonable and driven by emotion.

"I do think we need to defend ourselves at times, but insulting them is not the way, especially when the offenders aren't particularly being aggravating (that's not to say annoying, but a legitimate attempt to incur your wrath). Was your ego really being heedlessly trampled? Was your self confidence in danger of unwarranted sufferance? Are you sure you deserved no ire or criticism?"

I don't need your standards for what is offensive to me. If people want to get me punished for being sensible in a way that does not effect them then I will get mad. Yes, I dont consider making a game 2vs5 from a 3vs5 to be a significant inconvenience to others. If you read the OP I have said idiocy triggers me. I really think Riot needs more ire or criticism than me. Also, I would be so much less angry if I knew those players were being punished too.

"People don't want to lose, but you shouldn't be MISERABLE. Even in the most one-sided ones." 

Maybe I didn't use the right word to describe playing an unfair losing game but its unnecessary discomfort. Why focus on the person who was flamed into playing a 3vs5 instead of Riot supporting the mindset that every game should be played no matter how one-sided? 

"And if they just wanted to play the damn game and for you to shut up, you were extremely childish at that point."

You probably didn't know this so its fine. They told me in chat they were going to report me and then I called them stupid. If they just wanted to play the game without me talking why would they tell me they are going to report me for afk? They didn't say come play the game or I will report you. They just told me they would report me. Is it not well known that telling other people that they are going to get reported is flaming? 

"If you're having a miserable time because you're losing, you're doing it wrong. If you play to win, losing games are the best times to learn how to improve, and realize your errors. But you won't improve if you don't acknowledge that or your errors. Since that's clearly not happening, you're just meandering through games, enjoying the ones you win, and suffering the ones you don't."

That is irrelevant and dumb in that circumstance. People learn the best when they are practicing closest to the real deal. That means I learn to play 5vs5 better when I play 5vs5. This is more likely to be true. Can you also imagine the feedback loop? You put more effort into dodging skill shots and find times to last hit but lose anyway because its a 3vs5. Its a punishing way to learn. You can't blame people for not wanting to learn under that circumstance.

Also, why are lecturing me on how I should have fun? Not every game needs to be serious. You already know that but since your ego was damaged you want to act the lecturer.

"Your point that Riot's rules are ...what was it? Ah, yes. TOXIC. Its baseless. "

I don't understand you. I mean toxic as poisonous to the game. It would make the game less enjoyable and make people want to quit. Have you not seen the other posts about soft inting and trolling and not getting punished? Do you understand other players have been enraged by seemingly disproportionate punishment? Flaming feeders and trolls can get them banned while trolling and leaving doesn't. There are others who feel that the rules are unfair.

I have seen them, and far more often than not, I'm consoling them, offering advice, things along those lines. Your case isn't particularly toxic, but it isn't mild either. You're basing your judgement on the feeling that others are getting away with more than what you did.

I very much understand that sentiment. I get that way with moderators and specialists on these forums from time to time. They, however, are expected to have a higher standard of behavior, so when I see them say things I've been punished for, I get bristly.

Every day I play the game, I go in self-assured that I'll have to put up with toxicity that this log frankly is. It's unpleasant, insulting, negative as hell, accusational all over the place from start to finish, and you blatantly violated multiple rules which includes:

Don't call for reports
Don't AFK
Don't insult
Don't be negative
Don't derail the game (I forget the proper wording right now but you are disregarding what I'm saying anyway)

I have also said that the system is increasingly sensitive and your chat might be evidence of that in comparisons to logs of old, but I've seen milder logs get the axe and no longer have pity for people who blatantly insult their peers and blame their situation for their misery. So if you want to keep believing your chat log is all innocent and the rules are simply violating you, go ahead. Look at my post history and you'll find people who really are victims. You are not one of them.

Those who have worse logs are being punished all the time, some of them are getting away with it, but to be the sheep at the slaughterhouse and crying that you're not the fat one that should be harvested?

Please.

The discussion focused onto me because you focused on to me and I replied to it. You are not focusing on whether or not the rules are stupid. You are focused on how I should act better. You understand the issues I have brought up could be applied to everyone? Just because I made a post when I was angry doesn't mean the points I made are invalid. I am disregarding what you say because you argue with the mindset that rules are everything without backing it up. For example the rule I shouldn't hit people. I would follow it even if it wasn't being enforced because it is bad to hurt others. Why is it bad? Because its a universal human belief. I won't get deeper because it can get complicated. Anyway, your posts have been targeting me not reason. I have tried to talk about the sensibility of the rules so many times but it has been ignored. And now you have the gull to call me a sheep crying at a slaughter house. Dude you are triggering me.

This thread is about you feeling the rules are toxic, in other words, that the rules are unfair, punish the wrong people, etc. You used your personal experience of getting punished to support your statement. Thus we talk about your personal experience. Even if we ignored your personal experience, your sentiment that the system is unfair and toxic is simply wrong.

"OP shouldn't be pandered and told he's in the right"
"you're saying they didn't get punished so clearly the rules are unfair"
"BobTheNoodles: How was the rule not toxic in this situation?"

"I go in self-assured that I'll have to put up with toxicity that this log frankly is. It's unpleasant"
"Frankly, the rules are designed to oust behavior like that. Mend your ways or begone."

Last time, yes, this whole dang thread is focused on you, your behavior, your point, and how much correcting it all needs.

"Even if we ignored your personal experience, your sentiment that the system is unfair and toxic is simply wrong."

I am not going to deny that I shouldn't at least be punished for being toxic in chat. To the degree of 25 chat restrictions while leaving the game does nothing? Don't think so. One of the main point is that Riot's agreement make others feel entitled to force other people to play a 3vs5. That entitlement is toxic. Just imagine someone else getting reported for afking a 3vs5. Would that be fair or useful?  How is flaming someone to play a punishing unfair game not toxic? Are you slow? Do me a favor and get some sleep. You don't realize how absurd you sound.

"Frankly, the rules are designed to oust behavior like that. Mend your ways or begone."

The rules are designed to discourage afk when the game is 3vs5? A sensible person would ignore that rule.

"And on top of that, you really did flame- this chunk in particular is where most of it is at.

BobTheNoodles: why u want him to stay? we still lose
BobTheNoodles: just take longer to lose"

You think saying that we will lose a 4vs5 when we were already behind is flaming? You think playing a losing game and getting punished for more effort is the better way to go? You just going to say derailing a player from winning is bad period? The rules are the absolute guides to our behaviors? I know what the rules are now but the discussion is about them being unfair and toxic. You really think its better to have players that are entitled to expect others to play a game where they have to try harder for a greater chance to fail? 

https://www.relativelyinteresting.com/10-commandments-rational-debate-logical-fallacies-explained/?utm_source=org
You broke the first rule. We could have talked about Riot's rules without you talking about me.

Edit response to the edited in first rule thing: AGAIN, WE ARE LITERALLY TALKING ABOUT YOU. We ARE talking about your character in your PERSONAL example. Were it someone else's example, we'd be talking about THEIR character. (facepalm)

The whole not quitting thing, it's not just a rule, it's good form- that if your allies don't want to surrender, you don't give up. You're calling that toxic entitlement, which I shall explain why it's wrong in as easy-to-understand, relatable methods I can. 

I recall cases where players were much more literally held hostage in a game, where the enemy refused to end, and allies refused to let it end. THAT is unfair. Yeah, a 3v5 is a far cry from a good game, but isn't automatically a wretched horrible experience. Your negative experience, I believe, was in large part your own doing.

I am going to say it is bad to derail a player who is still trying to win- specifically when there are two at least of them on your team. As mentioned before, by playing League, you are agreeing by the terms of service to respect that. We all accept that. To turn around and say that's a toxic rule, that's foul. How many times did I say reform or get out? This is a team game and you shouldn't leave people behind. Most of us are honoring that agreement, though there are dissenters. The rules try to oust them- *harsh glare*. Be glad it doesn't require a unanimous vote to surrender.

The surrender vote is quite fair when it takes at least two people to say "I still want to play" to do so. We've already covered, to your agreement, that your response to that was toxic in your example. How would you like it if were the reverse, that it only took 2 people to declare a surrender? Can you imagine the frustration that would cause?

You're calling it punishment to play a losing game, but if that's to be accepted, then we should always immediately cease playing games where we're losing. Slippery slope, you see. The only time you get to give up is when majority of of your allies and you (post 20) agree to give up- or all your allies and not you.

I have boldly stated that the rules are absolutely NOT guidelines for good morality, but that does not mean they are devoid of it. Being sportsmanlike means not giving up until your team is ready to surrender, and some of the rules were based on that belief. It not even need be over victory, it could simply be in enjoying the game. It should be quite a natural conclusion - to be allowed to play the game, you must play unto the conclusion of the game, come what may. 

For whatever reason, your example, they didn't quit. As previously stated, they really don't care about you. It is really Quite Childish to assume they wanted You to suffer, even if they said that is what they were doing. As stated, they ARE entitled to the game, and you ARE expected to give that to them. If you are not enjoying yourself and not getting along with them, of course... leave the game, if that's what you want.

But please don't come back. You've demonstrated again and again that its all about how much You enjoy the game and don't really care about others. Even if you don't like them, the expectation is the same.

Hell, they even made a Terms of Service, an agreement that has some legal weight, that says you'll honor that expectation, a fair and sportsmanlike one. And here you are, calling it Toxic Entitlement.

Does that help?

:)
